notesStmt.note: Damaged by damp and mould. Large losses. Dark stains. Splits across text areas, edges with many splits. All repaired and inlaid before rebinding.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Biblical fragments ('Second Gaster Bible') with masorah magna and parva .

collation.p: Fragments of the parchment folios stamped on paper leaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script, punctuated, of the last quarter of the 11th century or first quarter of the 12th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 34rNumerous golden rosettes and medallions between the lines, the text columns and in the margins, in colours and gold.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Biblical Fragments. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Or. 9880.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Gaster (b. 1856, d. 1939), scholar and rabbi: his manuscript, Cod. G. 150; purchased by the British Museum from him on 12 April, 1924: inscribed, [38v].
